meanings.definition: In an insular manner; narrowly or provincially.
meanings.sent1: She thought insularly, only considering her own opinions.
meanings.sent2: He spoke insularly, never wanting to hear different viewpoints.
meanings.sent3: The cat insularly decided that only one corner of the house belonged to her.
meanings.sent4: The old man lived insularly, isolated from the changing world around him.
meanings.sent5: The student's insularly focused study habits limited his understanding of diverse perspectives.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to an island or islands.
meanings.sent1: The insularly culture of the small island was fascinating to outsiders.
meanings.sent2: The insularly community relied on fishing for their livelihood.
meanings.sent3: The insularly landscape was dotted with palm trees and sandy beaches.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was an insularly island, untouched by the chaos of the city.
meanings.sent5: The insularly birds on the island had unique colors and songs.
